title: Man fined after two sheep and unborn lambs die after dog attack in Ashford
summary:
Sign me up for news alertsA dog owner has been fined after two sheep and two unborn lambs died following dog attacks in Ashford.
Charlie Hawker, 28, of Appledore Road, Kenardington admitted two counts of sheep worrying and has been banned from having a dog off a lead in public.
Charlie HawkerOn Thursday, March 10, a sheep died after Hawker's dog chased and attacked it on agricultural land near Kenardington.
That sheep also died, as well as two unborn lambs.
Hawker was fined £300 for each offence and ordered to pay both victims compensation at Folkestone Magistrates' Court on Thursday.
